title: What if Sri Lanka, Ceylon, had been a white settler colony? - Quora

response.answer_text: It was a colony at one point.  Colombo, in the time of British rule (Source: Central Bank of Sri Lanka) But Sri Lanka is a tiny island which is not suitable for the growth of many crops the empire wanted to grow in Americas and Australia. We did not have known rich veins of gold, silver, copper, petroleum or other valuable minerals. Our importance came from the location at the center of two maritime routes, spices, ivory, pearls and gemstones. Besides our social structure was a centralized one, with a sovereign king, ministers, local rulers and people unified instead of scattered in to tribes. Sri Lanka had long been exposed to Europeans by the time British came along. Plus the Kandyan nobles surrendered to the Empire under a treaty, not by a complete military defeat. Battles were usually fought in wilderness where the foreign armies had to fend off guerilla attacks as wells as malaria-carrying mosquitoes. So it wasn’t easy, economical or logical for the colonists to completely wipe us out. Instead they followed the strategy of “divide and conquer” playing on the frictions between various groups inside the country so that they may never unite against the common enemy.  Source: Cairns Family History, the Cairns family history, titled native headmen of British Ceylon, though by dress at least the four in the front are nobles (royal officials) while the topless ones with large hats are minor officials. If it became a colony though, I suppose I’d be living in a reservation somewhere being a “noble savage” and all today. Most probably I’d be classified as a minority in my own country, have never learnt to speak the language of my ancestors, completely unaware of millennia of knowledge my people have amassed and deeply ashamed of my skin color that is the same hue as the earth of my land. I’d probably not be a Buddhist either, since the cultural revival movement my grandparents were a part of would have never happened or would have been ruthlessly solved.  A list of leaders who were declared traitors to the crown in January 1818 and killed, their properties seized in the aftermath of the Uwa-Wellassa uprising. The paddy fields of the villages who joined the uprising were sown with salt, all males including children were killed. This paper was signed on 8th December 2016 canceling the previous declaration and titling them as “heroes and leaders who fought for freedom with patriotic spirit”. Source: Sri Lanka News | Sri Lankan Breaking news,Hot News - Adaderana -Truth First  Source:https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-navajo-nations-infection-rate-10-times-higher-than-arizonas-2020-4 It is a very bleak picture on my side. On outside, this island probably would look better that it does today. Taller buildings, better infrastructure, higher GDP, better fed and whiter people….There would have been better horror movies too, since then they’d have all those mass-burial grounds of natives to build insane asylums on.  Source:‘A Living Burial’: Inside the Hiawatha Asylum for Insane Indians Nicer museums with galleries upon galleries with lost culture of the natives for school children to gaze at, thousand ancient statues of Buddha to be auctioned, bought and kept as paper weights or decorations, moonstones to decorate a millionaire's doorway, Sinhalese script to be studied by archeologists, conspiracy theories of aliens or illuminati building all those decaying stupas….  Source: Aboriginal Culture in Sydney  Now imagine this done with a thousand year old statue, worshipped by millions and safeguarded with the blood, sweat and tears of my ancestors. Source:https://www.wayfair.com/keyword.php?keyword=buddha+candle  Current leader of the aboriginal Vedda people of Sri Lanka holding the skull of a tribesman returned from a British Museum to rest in peace 200 years later. Source:https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2019/11/22/returning-museum-objects-former-colonies-risks-denying-britains/  Colombo, the economical capital of Sri Lanka, Source: The Commonwealth Anyway, I'd rather be me, Chaya, living in the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka with all its problems and all its beauties, and be able to pass on the names of all the trees, animals, mountains and rivers to my children, to be able to pass on my language and religion and names of kings, queens and ancestors who walked this land before us, write it down with our own script, have a home to return to no matter where I travel in this world.  Source: Home - AUKANA RAJAMAHA VIHARAYA ; a country is not just a bit of land. It is where your heart is free to beat at its own rhythm. Hope this helped!
